Kural_Info.Tamil_Text: இரவார் இரப்பார்க்கொன்று ஈவர் கரவாதுகைசெய்தூண் மாலை யவர்.
Kural_Info.English_Meaning: Those whose nature is to live by manual labour will never beg but give something to those who beg.

Layered_Composition.Foreground: A farmer, whose hands are strong and calloused from manual labor ('கை செய்து ஊண்'), is shown.
Layered_Composition.Midground: A beggar ('இரப்பார்') comes to him asking for alms.
Layered_Composition.Background: The farmer, despite his own humble status, does two things. First, he himself does not beg ('இரவார்'). Second, he freely and without hiding anything ('கரவாது'), gives a portion of his own hard-earned food to the beggar ('ஒன்று ஈவர்').

Art_Direction.Subject_and_Action: Those who live by the dignity of their own labor will never stoop to beg themselves; on the contrary, they will freely give to those who do.
Art_Direction.Symbolic_Motifs: The farmer's strong, working hands are a symbol of his dignity and self-reliance. His open-handed gesture of giving, even though he is not wealthy, shows his superior moral character. The contrast between the dignified worker and the supplicant beggar is key.
Art_Direction.Lighting_and_Color: A strong, honest, daylight illuminates the scene. The farmer is depicted with a noble and dignified expression. The act of giving is the central, warmly lit focus of the image.

Technical_Cues.Camera: An eye-level shot that captures the interaction with a sense of respect and dignity, focusing on the farmer's honorable choice.
Technical_Cues.Resolution: 8K, ultra-realistic, with a focus on the textures of the working hands and the simple food.
Technical_Cues.Lighting: Natural, honest lighting that ennobles the farmer.
Technical_Cues.Art_Genre: Social realism, in the style of Jean-François Millet.
